programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested...

programme.title: Uncommon Courtesy
programme.desc: Many believe the Edwardian society was a rigid system of empty gestures and rituals and was just too restrictive in the lives of people. Well, the Edwardians didn’t quite see it that way. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder takes a fascinating look at how...

programme.title: Exploring Titanic
programme.desc: Called Titanic’s “Greatest Explorer,” PH Nargeolet takes us deep inside the wreck for a revealing look at Titanic’s interior.

programme.title: Nazi Germany’s Version of Titanic
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes of the German movie “Titanic” — commissioned by Nazi Propaganda Minister Joseph Goebbels. German Titanic Society President Malte Fiebing-Petersen tells the unique story behind the film— from a script based on a Jewish...

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 1
programme.desc: Ken Marschall take us behind the scenes for a remarkable look at the making of James Cameron’s Titanic. If you’ve ever wondered how they built the ship and everything around it to look so real, this is an episode you can’t miss.

programme.title: The Hazards of First-Class Travel
programme.desc: Traveling first-class on Titanic was certainly luxurious. Most of the passengers were very pleasant and the food was good, but you had to be careful about letting your guard down. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder reveals the very real dangers of...

programme.title: Was Captain Smith Legally in Command of the Titanic?
programme.desc: Senan Molony has uncovered a completely overlooked Irish document, that seems to confirm Captain Smith was not legally in command of Titanic when she sailed from Southampton on April 10, 1912.

programme.title: Remembering Eva Hart
programme.desc: Charles Haas reflects on his friend, Titanic survivor Eva Hart, in an emotional never before told story of their last encounter and Eva’s surprising change of heart about recovering artifacts.

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was...

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 2
programme.desc: In the second part of this two-part series, Host Ken Marschall continues his remembrance of his friend Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: Titanic's Three Bladed Propeller
programme.desc: Based on a famous 1911 photograph of Olympic in dry dock, it has always been assumed that Titanic had an identical four-bladed center propeller. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside has uncovered a Harland & Wolff document that describes a three-bladed...

programme.title: Shipwreck Diving
programme.desc: With the recent discovery of the German submarine in the North Sea, we decided to go into the archives and take another look at Richie Kohler’s Shipwreck Diving. In this remarkable episode, Richie tells of his own extraordinary discovery of a World...

programme.title: Did the Lifeboats Douse Their Lights?
programme.desc: Evidence seems to suggest that lifeboats doused their lights to avoid being overcome by survivors in the water. It is indeed a grim side of the Titanic story. Senan Molony gives us the full account of what happened that night.

programme.title: Fixing The Wireless
programme.desc: If Jack Phillips had followed the rules, the wireless set would have still been broken the night the Titanic hit the iceberg and the Carpathia may never have received the distress call in time. Instead, Jack took initiative and fixed it himself and...

programme.title: Titanic’s Pumps
programme.desc: Titanic’s engineers have always been an enduring story as they struggled with the pumps downstairs trying to keep them going to the very end. Was there ever any hope in their heroism?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: Did Titanic Have Inferior Steel?
programme.desc: It’s been a theory talked about for years; were the rivets and steel used in Titanic inferior? Parks looks at the science of the debate and very well may put an end to the controversy.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Was Olympic Retired Too Soon?
programme.desc: Olympic was taken out of service in 1935, after nearly a quarter of a century of a very successful career. Was she retired too soon? It certainly seems there was still plenty of life in her. Mark Chirnside looks at the reasons she was scrapped and why...

programme.title: The Story Behind Titanic's Real Time Sinking
programme.desc: Tom Lynskey and Matt DeWinkeleer take us behind the scenes of their amazingly popular 2 hour 40 minute Titanic Sinks in REAL TIME. With over 17,670,154 views, it definitely captured the world’s attention.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Hong Kong Cyclothon 2023
programme.desc: The circuit in the heart of the city of Hong Kong, made up of 24 laps totaling 103.2 km, offered a fast and technical race. With an abundance of turns, the race felt like a stretched rubber band that eventually gave way, as some riders described it. The constant pressure and aggressiveness in the race created opportunities for decisive attacks.

programme.title: Freewheeling 2023 Ep.1 Tour du Rwanda (Eng)
programme.desc: First episode of HorizonSports exclusive magazine dedicated to Pro-Cycling races. This episode gives a full overview of Tour of Rwanda with a complete summary of the race and exclusive in depth interviews of the winner and his team leader.

programme.title: Tour de France Saitama Criterium 2024
programme.desc: The Tour de France Saitama Criterium Japan race weekend includes races for both professionals and amateurs. The two-day programme culminates with the criterium race featuring 28 top international riders (Marc Cavendish, Romain Bardet, Chris Froome ...) from some of the worlds best professional cycling teams (Red Bull, Astana, Bahrain Victorious ...)

programme.title: The First Second - Geraldine Fasnacht
programme.desc: When Geraldine, the bird woman puts on her mask, we know that the images of the pink wingsuit will be closer to poetry than adrenaline! Several snowboard world championship titles, more than 3200 jumps, but at the start, how do you decide to ride and fly all your life?

programme.title: Titan Desert Morocco 2020
programme.desc: A look back at the 2020 edition of the Titan Desert, a six-stage mountain bike race in the Moroccan desert. Orientation and endurance are two essential assets for a course that will make you discover the most incredible landscapes of Morocco over nearly 640 kilometers.

programme.title: DATEV Challenge Roth 2024
programme.desc: The triathlon in Roth Germany took place again on July 7th 2024. The sports festival in the triathlon stronghold has been home to triathletes from all over the world since 1984. 3.8 km swimming, 180 km cycling and 42.2 km running through the triathlon district of Roth. Emotions and goose bumps are guaranteed, for example at the mythical swim start at the Main-Danube Canal, at the legendary Solar Hill or at the magical finishline party in the triathlon stadium.Le triathlon de Roth en Allemagne a eu lieu à nouveau le 7 juillet 2024. Depuis 1984, la fête sportive du bastion du triathlon accueille des triathlètes du monde entier. 3,8 km de natation, 180 km de cyclisme et 42,2 km de course à pied à travers le quartier du triathlon de Roth. . Les émotions et la chair de poule sont garanties, par exemple lors du départ mythique de la natation au canal Main-Danube, sur la légendaire colline solaire ou lors de la fête darrivée magique dans le stade de triathlon.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2023 - Rio
programme.desc: The GWA Wingfoil World Tour hits Rio De Janeiro for a pure Wave event in 2023! Here the Wave discipline is held. The focus of this ground-breaking discipline will be riding waves, using the power of the swell to surf with commitment and flow. Scores will also be given for aerial tricks, but those must be executed without the power of the wing. It promises to be an engrossing competition and a spectacular addition to the fast-evolving world tour. The Top-ranked riders from wingfoil Surf-Freestyle are eager to put their wave-riding skills against their rivals.

programme.title: Visit Qatar GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2023
programme.desc: The first event of the new season is held at the Fuwairit Kite Beach Resort in Qatar opening the series with the Visit Qatar GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup.2023 Freestyle-Kite competition format:Among some smaller technical adaptations to trick family structures that aim to increase competitive excitement, essentially the Freestyle-Kite competition format will still see the four highest scoring tricks counting to a rider’s heat score from a total allowance of seven trick attempts.For 2023 Freestyle-kite fleets sizes remain the same as in the year before; limited to 28 or 14 competitors (men usually have 28 and women usually have 14). The fleet numbers for each event are realised as follows:28 riders: Top 22 ranked riders from previous season plus 6 different wildcards.14 riders: Top 11 ranked riders from previous season plus 3 different wildcards.

programme.title: Kite Masters 2024 Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode we will travel to Austria. Once again, Lake Traunsee in Upper Austria set a magnificent backdrop for action – the 2024 KiteFoil World Series Austria took place almost a month after the conclusion of the Olympic Games and attracted riders that were eager to challenge themselves in such a unique venue.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2023 New Zealand
programme.desc: Opening up the 2023 GWA season, the Tip Top GWA Wingfoil World Cup, presented by Armstrong Foils, is the first the GWA event in New Zealand or the Pacific. Featuring both the Surf-Slalom and Surf-Freestyle disciplines, this first world cup event of the season will be held at Mount Maunganui Main Beach over 6 days of an 8 day window, 3rd-11th March. Over this event period in early March there are to expect wind strengths of 10-18 knots each day in the afternoons with the sea breezes further building up to 15-25 knots.

programme.title: Route du Rhum 2022 - Full Summary (Eng)
programme.desc: Complete summary of the 2022 edition of the Route du Rhum. The famous transatlantic race was, once again, completely epic. 138 sailors competed in the Ultim, Ocean 50, Imoca, Class 40, Rhum Multi and Rhum Mono categories. The ocean has been ruthless with some and generous with others and for all the adventure has been incredible.

programme.title: Impressive performance
programme.desc: Our Bacci del Buono is in Costa Smeralda to test the Sea Water Phantom 300, a beautiful model that will give you unique emotions. Studied in the smallest details, this inflatable boat has nothing to envy to the larger models belonging to the same line.

programme.title: Salpa Avantgarde 35 - A powerful walk-around
programme.desc: Salpa dinghies stand out for their comfort and practicality, as well as this powerful walk-around, the Avantgarde 35.

programme.title: Nimbus T8 Compact powerful fun
programme.desc: Nimbus T8 is a sporty and versatile tender, designed for comfort and handling. It is equipped with Simrad NSX by Navico Group, a cutting-edge navigation system for an intuitive and safe driving experience.

programme.title: Sōlace 37Pilot – A versatile center console
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is aboard the 37PILOT from the new SŌLACE Pilot series, a versatile, all-weather, luxury center console boat.

programme.title: Beneteau First 44 Performance and Comfort under Sailing

programme.title: A maxi sailboat

programme.title: Salon Nautique de Paris 2021 - Inflatable boats

programme.title: Italia Yachts - The Shipyard

programme.title: Solaris 60 Blue water ambitions
programme.desc: Hop on-board together with Antonio Vettese on the boat that become the emblem of blue water ambitions, Solaris 60, constructed in Italy by Solaris Yachts.

programme.title: Swan 55 – A winning bet
programme.desc: Antonio Vettese is on board the new sailing Yacht Swan 55 seen at Cannes International Boat Show 2022. Discover its performance.

programme.title: Ecoracer 25 - A virtuous triptych

programme.title: Eng 5 Residential Fire
programme.desc: Station 5, its the first morning of this 48 hour shift. They are all doing chores working on the yard. They had just finished up when the call came in; it sounds like a structure fire. As they are in route, it comes over the radio that neighbors are calling in, they see smoke. Engine 5 arrives on scene, the 1st In, and they pull a line, Mike is on the nozzle, and we go into the fire with Mike as he enters the garage, and its blazing. After the fire, they all re-hab, get their bottles filled while the Battalion Chief goes over the ops.

OAN hosts Matt Gaetz and Dan Ball bring their fiery, “not safe for broadcast news” insight to The Anchormen Show. Each week, the pair will give their hot takes on culture and news in a way unlike anywhere else in media.
Real America with Dan Ball brings you the latest political headlines, by interviewing news makers of the day, to include politicians, lawmakers, pundits, celebrities and social media influencers.

Host Riley Lewis talks all things censorship, propaganda, representation, and saving America's democracy. This show is dedicated to discussing real issues and providing every viewer with the real story behind trending headlines in an engaging way.

OAN sits down with national leaders to discuss current events. Hear from policy makers what shapes their decisions & what to expect from our leaders. WB provides exclusive insights, & a panel of experts to discuss today’s news

Chanel Rion leads bold and uncensored discourse on Big Tech, Big Media, and Big Government. From thought leaders to world leaders, join Chanel as she pierces through the scripts, and reads between the lies. Weeknights on OAN.

programme.desc: Ever wonder what really makes a trader tick? programme.title: Market Overtime

The show is a conversation looking at what is driving headlines globally, and what these trends mean for markets, the economy, and your financial future. What are the stories that will impact your portfolio for the next year, next decade and beyond? Tune in to Market Overtime to get a new perspective on investing.

programme.title: The Wrap
programme.desc: The Wrap is a nightly recap show, delivering the day’s top market headlines and most insightful interviews from Schwab Network's daily market coverage. Airing daily at 7pm ET, it highlights key takeaways from the trading session, expert analysis, and actionable ideas from the network’s best conversations—giving investors a concise, informative look at what moved the markets and what to watch next.

programme.title: Fast Market

programme.title: "UFA 331-332,339 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 7"
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7 part 1 Gibson vs. Bayasgalan. In this episode Garrett Williams and Adam Garcia duke it out in a Lightweight bout. Bryen Dao faces Anthony Romero and in the main event, Chase Gibson takes on Ganbat Bayasgalan. United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7 part 2 Gulo vs Taco. Jairee Emon Baker faces Kameron Fardad with a lightweight title on the line, Dion Young faces Alessandri Ridruguez and Christopher "Taco" Padilla faces Serob Minasyan in the main event. United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7, Part 3 - Segura vs. Brock. Watch as Khaleel Pearson takes on Jonathan Winland, William Elliott faces Steve Mora in a bantamweight bout and knockout specialists Devon Brock and Mike Segura put there skills to the test in a lightweight match.

programme.title: UFA 323 - KOK 102 Nicosia
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents KOK from Nicosia, Cyprus. Panagiotis Eleftheriou from Athens Greece faces Stefanos Argyrou of Cyprus, Kyriakos Alepidis and Dimitirs Tzeranidis both from Cyprus and with 9 wins under their belt face off in a high caliber fight. Christos Margaronis from Greece takes on Delil Timur, Muay Thai champion of Cyprus and in the main event, the more experienced Greek Manolis Kailistis takes on the younger Nicosian Ismael Al Khadi in a title bout.

programme.title: UFA 322 - KOK 101 Slovakia
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents KOK 101 from Slovakia. The more experienced fighter Dalibor Ognanov of North Macedonia faces Peter Maasz of Slovakia, female Slovenian fighters Linrong Sang making her pro-debut and Viktoria Docekalova face off in the ring, in a Welterweight fight Ykos Ibragimov from Azerbaijan takes on Jan Sindelar from the Czech Republic and Slovakian fighters Timotej Frangez and Jozef Hurak square off in the ring.

programme.title: UFA 360-362 - KOK 104 World Series Kaunas
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 1. Starting the night is a lightweight match between Tiago Mendes and Champion Mindaugas Narauskas. Nika Khelaidze takes on Vitoldas Jagelo in an MMA Bushido contest, Jussi Pirttikangas faces Erikas Golubovskis, Nicola Kisari, making his pro-debut, and Nauris Lukosiunas face off in a Romania versus Lithuania matchup. Also watch Bruno Borges from Portugal take on Lithuanian Samuelis Sorochovas. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 2. In this episode Soslan Gasiev faces former heavyweight champion Tomas Pakutinskas, up and comers Arnestas Naujokas and Gustas Dimsa faceoff in the ring, Polands Jakub Kwasniewski faces charasmatic Vitas Karosas from Lithuania, experienced fighters Filip Rzadek and Ignas Barysas look to make their match fight of the night. United Fight Alliance presents King of Kings 104 World Series Kaunas, Lithuania part 3. First up Moldovanian Nicolai Garbuz faces Mantas Kondratavicius of Lithuania in an MMA Bushido bout and Sasa Polugic takes on Mantas Rimdeika for some heavyweight action. In the main event Simon Santana and Matas Pultarazinskas head to the ring for a featherweight bout with the World Championship up for grabs.

programme.title: Downtown Eats in NYC
programme.desc: Get the lowdown on best restaurants in downtown Manhattan from Andrew Zimmer, former NY editor at Thrillist and current Deputy Editor at Time Out New York.

programme.title: Gateway of Arizona: Chandler's Unique Lifestyle
programme.desc: What does population and economic growth in Chandler, Arizona mean for this summers travel plans? Find out here, and discover the unique lifestyle this Sonoran city offers.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: Where To Eat in Ventura County Coast
programme.desc: Ventura County has its share of incredible eateries and drinking establishments. We asked local experts on where they go. See our list here.

programme.title: Behold One Of The World's Most Dangerous Travel Attractions
programme.desc: This is perhaps the worlds scariest hike.

programme.title: Issaya
programme.desc: The dining room is a daring mix of classic and modern furniture on terracotta tile floors with unusually colourful wallpapers. The whole room basks in a very soft light and the result works surprising well. The menu, both in Thai and English, is not illustrated but cleverly written, keeping the phonetic dish names instead of an elaborated but hard to visualize description. The wine list is substantial and several excellent wines are available by the glass.

programme.title: Craziest Things You Can Do on a Cruise
programme.desc: The cruise industry is loaded w/ luxury, high-tech, & outright crazy attractions. Check out these amazing deals on cruises & get ready to get crazy!

programme.title: Classic NYC Burgers
programme.desc: Travel Savvy asked Americas foremost hamburger expert George Motz to find the best burger in NYC. Check out these local New York burger places on your trip!

programme.title: Tour of quirky Anna Maria Island, Florida
programme.desc: Take a video tour of Anna Maria Island, Florida, where chain restaurants and hotels are nearly impossible to find. Instead this Gulf of Mexico island thrives on a mix of California earthiness and Florida quirkiness.

programme.title: Chiloe: Exploring Chile's Largest Island & Warmest Secret
programme.desc: The snowy peaks of the Andes are visible, but whats this? Lush rolling hills, a radical new resort and biking in (gasp!) shorts? Welcome to Chiloé, the archipelago Chileans covet most. Islands videographer Jon Whittle shares why from the poshest resort in Patagonia, Refugia.

programme.title: Judy Joo's Ethnic Bites in London
programme.desc: Iron Chef Judy Joo shares her cant-miss list of ethnic dining in London. From dim sum in Soho to sushi in Marylebone, find the best here.

programme.title: How University Students Enjoy London
programme.desc: Riah Banks, a student at the University of the Arts London, tells us all about the best clubs & hangouts in London. Hear all about her favorites here!

programme.title: Dubai: Discover the jewels in the crown of the city's civilisation
programme.desc: When people think of Dubai it is often thought of as a new city. But, in fact, its history goes back more than 5,000 years. Archaeologists have unearthed a series of exciting and mysterious discoveries across the Emirate. These include the Jumeirah Archaeological site, which dates back to the Abbasid Period in the 10th century AD, to the Saruq Al Hadid site – a centre for human inhabitants and trade and metallurgy from the Umm Al Nar period (2600-2000 BCE) to the Iron Age. When the Jumeirah Archaeological site was discovered, experts noticed that the walls of the buildings there were plastered. Dr Mansour Boraik, an archaeology specialist from Dubai, said: "It was plastered inside and outside with white plaster. When they tried to picture the city during the Abbasid Period, and they imagined that it would look like a white city from the shores of the Gulf." The site shows Dubai during the Abbasid period which is around the 10th century AD. The geographical location of the site is important. It sits on the shoreline of Dubai but also on the major trade route between Mesopotamia, India and Oman. It also sits in-between the Arabic and Indian peninsular. The 80,000 square metre site sits in the shadow of the Burj Khalifa and the imposing Dubai skyline, emphasising the comparison between old and new worlds. The circular and semi-circular tower supports reflect the prosperity of the inhabitants of the time who will have been a mixture of locals and passing tradesmen. A variety of silver coins, pottery, copper, glass and stone artefacts have been excavated. Its one of the largest and most important Islamic sites ever discovered in the Gulf. It is also home to the oldest Mosque discovered in the UAE. Saruq al Hadid Saruq al Hadid is regarded as the jewel in the crown of archaeological discoveries In Dubai. This ancient industrial metallurgical centre dates back to the Iron Age and indicates that Dubai was a global trading hub. Ahmed Mahmoud, Director of Architectural Heritage Department in Dubai, said

programme.title: Shopping in Downtown NYC
programme.desc: NYC shops that you will not find in the mall. Punk rock musician Jesse Malin gives list of where to shop for books, consignment clothes, guitars, and condoms.

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: Dubai Creek: Discover a lost Arabian world
programme.desc: Dubai Creek flows through the Emirates historic heart. For just one dirham, abra rides provide boatloads of nostalgia while travelling between the souks and museums of Deira and Bur Dubai. These heritage hubs recall the Bedouins’ humble and ancient past built on pearls, and then shaped by a free trade boom that brought new settlers to the creek in the early 1900’s. Echoing that era, today’s expats – some descendants of those early traders – share authentic flavours from their homelands in a culinary kaleidoscope that compliments Emirati fare. Popular food tours Food tours are a popular way to explore Dubai Creek. Arva Ahmed is the founder of Frying Pan Adventures. She describes one of the restaurants that features on the tours itinerary. "One of the restaurants we stop on our tour is called Sultan Dubai Falafel," she says. "And the thing that they are known for is stuffed falafels. They stuff them with chilli, onion and sumac. These falafels are the most juiciest most filled with herbs and fragrant falafels that you’re going to find in the city." Deira’s Waterfront market is piled high with technicolour fruit and vegetables and stacks of shellfish with legs choreographed in chorus-line unison. Here you can buy the catch of the day and have it cooked in many different ways for old-school Creekside dining. Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary Until recently, the creek ended at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary. Here nature lovers can spot flamingos that migrate to the Sanctuary, a wetland extension of the creek spread over 6.2 sq.km. It features a variety of mangroves and lagoons perfect for migrating birds - the sanctuary is home to over 180 species of birds. Following its expansion as Dubai Canal, the creek curves past book-shaped Mohammed Bin Rashid Library, high-rise Business Bay and beach-hugging Jumeirah before it’s reunited with its source - the glittering Arabian Gulf.

programme.title: Monkey Island
programme.desc: Needing a break from the bright lights of the big city? An escape to a simpler way of life is just a 90 minute trip from Bangkok to Monkey Island in Samut Songkhram province. For 700bht you can take a boat ride to meet the famous swimming monkeys and see how the local fishing community (Khlong Klone) lives. After feeding those ravenous monkeys some bananas, treat yourself to some amazing local seafood. It may be a perfect end to a low key Sunday after a night of the other kind of monkey business.

My journey begins at the Orlando World Center Marriott, home to the biggest most amazing pool I’ve ever seen. What makes it even more amazing is the fact that mermaid classes are offered through the Mermaid Academy, poolside. The real adventure begins at the Paddling Center at Shingle Creek, which is a quick drive from the hotel. Lined with Cypress trees and the beautiful sounds of nature, it was the perfect setting for a relaxing kayak experience. I end my time in Orlando shopping at Artegon Marketplace. This is mall filled with local artisans who are passionate about their work and products. My highlight was being able to ride on a cute stuffed mechanical animal as I peruse the shops.

programme.title: Balloon trip gives passengers a real bird’s eye view of the desert
programme.desc: Ballooning is the earliest form of human flight. In 18th century France, King Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette watched as the first passengers - a duck, a rooster and a sheep - took off in one from Versailles . These days it’s a big attraction for tourists the world over. But in Dubai, hot air ballooning comes with a twist. You can fly with a peregrine falcon. Falconer Dylan Freeman says its the only place in the world where you can fly with the fastest animal on the planet. “What were trying to simulate here is having the falcon soaring. “Theyve been recorded reaching speeds of 389 km/h in a dive. From one kilometre up he can see a pigeon four kilometres away. So then he would fly above it, fold up his wings, and dive down really quickly to try and catch it.” Peter Kollar, co-founder and chief pilot of Balloon Adventures Dubai , says dawn is a good time to take to the skies. “Its a beautiful area because its a mix of desert, pristine desert …… and there are green oases in the desert, which gives a beautiful contrast.” Kollar says the route the balloon takes is very much up to the weather. “Eighty per cent of my work is meteorology. If we get the weather right my job is relatively simple. Really ballooning is true flying because you have to use Mother Nature.”

programme.title: A quintessential quarantine dish
programme.desc: With the world still in lockdown to combat the coronavirus, delicious food is a topic everyone can rally around. Euronews met up with Chef Othman Reif at his Japanese restaurant in Dubai, Kushiyaki, to taste one of his signature dishes. "You’re going to get a piece of Wagyu, thin cut. And we’re going to brush with a little bit of the wagyu fat. Just sear on the one side. Have a little bit of fun you know what I mean. It’s simple, easy you know, no hassle." Click on the video link above to see how its done. ​

programme.title: Things to do in Al Quoz, Dubai’s art hub, home to Alserkal Avenue, artisan cafes and classic cars
programme.desc: Once just an overlooked industrial estate hidden behind the high-rises of Dubai’s Sheikh Zayed Road, Al Quoz is now the beating heart of the citys art scene. Home to Alserkal Avenue – actually a block of streets lined with some of the best art galleries in Dubai – Al Quoz is full of surprises. There’s more than world-class art hidden behind Al Quozs vast landscape of warehouses; where theres art, theres life, after all – and life here is vibrant. Just about every enterprise in Al Quoz comes with an exciting twist; for example, Al Quoz restaurant and speciality coffee bar Café Rider doubles as a custom motorbike store. Mirzam , meanwhile, is an artisan chocolate factory thats also a café, located in the neighbourhood’s central art hub, Alserkal Avenue . Alserkal Avenue cafes are defined by their fair-trade principles and creative concoctions that echo the area’s artistic character. From golden turmeric lattes to immune-boosting vegan matcha bowls, menus are bursting with goodness. Things to do in Alserkal Avenue and neighbouring complex, The Courtyard, include inspiring workshops; there are several to choose between. At Oo La Lab , a fragrance mixology studio in Alserkal Avenue, you can learn how to create your own signature cologne. Or, just across the road, you can join an art class in Dubai’s popular community art space thejamjar . Going strong for 15 years, thejamjar is a regular host of Alserkal Avenue events and art lessons, teaches budding artists of all ages several disciplines, from painting with oils to acrylic techniques. Tilika D’Souza, an art instructor at thejamjar, says the wellbeing of the participants is also important to the foundation: "We have a workshop called Intuitive Creativity that combines meditation and art; we use all kinds of different art materials and we do a little meditation to begin with, so everybody is really relaxed during and after the class." For those who prefer to shop, tempting retail options include independent boutiques, such as Chi-Ka , a

programme.title: Visiting Dubai's many museums
programme.desc: Dubai is home to a multitude of museums, from world-firsts to hidden gems. Quranic Park is one of the citys brand new attractions. About the size of 60 rugby fields, it has been created to give visitors some green space and a better understanding of Islamic beliefs. Inside the park’s orchards and Glass House, visitors can discover a variety of healthy and medicinal flora featured in the Holy Quran, from pomegranates and olives, to figs and garlic. Another attraction at Quranic Park is the Cave of Miracles, where seven miracles recounted in the Holy Quran play out on the walls. "The cave was amazing," says Usman, who is visiting from the UK. "We learnt a lot about the miracles growing up, it just gave another understanding to it. And it was great to visualise it, not just hear about it." "This is an open example that the Quran is not just to read in order to get reward but it is something that can be in practical life," says Anwar, a visitor from the US. "This place is beautiful and a very interesting experience for children. Here, they can actually experience things from the Quran," says Miteab, who lives in Saudi Arabia. Al Shindagha Perfume House From aromatic flora to the UAE’s first museum dedicated to fragrance. The Al Shindagha museum is home to the Perfume House . Part of a complex created to gather, preserve and share Emirati heritage, Perfume House charts the history and role of fragrance in the region. Rashed Almuhairi is Perfume House’s Chief Cultural Guide. “It’s special and important not only for the guests who are coming, he tells Euronews. "It’s for our own generations also. A lot of our youth, they didn’t live in many things like perfuming or pearl diving, so it’s important that they know about our past life. Dubai has a very rich history which needs to be told.” One of the more unusual exhibits on display is a 28 kilogramme piece of oud. Oud is formed in aquilaria trees when they are infected with a particular type of mould. This resinous heartwood is the key ingr

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Adventures – Explore, dive and discover the sealife in Dubai’s waters
programme.desc: An hour and a half away from the city of Dubai, Euronews James OHagan joined the Dubai-based centre Divers Down to complete his PADI training and have his first proper dive. Michela Colella, Operations Manager, Divers Down UAE said, "We will go to an average depth of 14 metres. We’ll look for trumpet fish, triggerfish, clownfish, pufferfish, boxfish." Even with the basic training completed, diving with an instructor helps you feel safer, develop the right habits, and take in all the best spots on the dive site. Some of the most spectacular coral and marine life are located just 5 metres from the surface. At that depth, everything is lit up beautifully and the air lasts much longer than at 10 or 15 metres. The reef has species ranging from stingrays to lobsters, jawfish, parrotfish, broomtail wrasse, and many others. For more experienced divers there are dozens of shipwrecks and artificial reefs to explore each with unique histories and coral formations. At times it feels as if you’re flying in slow motion in some sort of alien landscape. And before you know it, it’s time to come back to the real world. Euronews James OHagan exclaimed, "Oh! That was incredible! Breathtaking!

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Theres the LA you see in the movies, and then theres the real LA—a gritty, fantastically diverse collection of neighborhoods sprawled between ocean and mountains, each with its own distinct mood. Los Angeles spent years striving to emulate towns like New York or San Francisco, but over the last decade the city took a long hard look in the mirror, dug what it saw, and started focusing on what it does best: casual, multicultural, and effortlessly cool.The new LA is the place everyone suddenly wants to be, where high and low converge on palm-lined sidewalks. The countrys most thriving food scene is here, run by a guerilla band of ethnically diverse chefs cooking up whatever they want, wherever they want, with the best produce in the world. From the industrial warehouses east of downtown to the beachside shopping meccas of Venice, LAs cutting edge street style, art scene, and culinary chops cant be contained—the creative energy pops through the concrete like ficus roots. And just to sweeten the deal, 280-plus days of breezy sunshine form the backdrop of it all. Just dont forget your shades.

programme.title: Keeping tradition alive in Dubai
programme.desc: Tradition isnt exactly what first comes to mind when one thinks of Dubai, a city that quite literally grew out of the desert, but tourists are flocking to the Middle Eastern oasis for a taste of its Bedouin past. Camel races Old meets new can be seen at Dubais Camel Racing Club where these ships of the desert sprint across the perimeter of the famed Al Mamoom racetrack. Attracting both camel owners and punters alike, spectators can sit in their cars and drive alongside the camels as they hurtle towards the finish line, guided by a remote control jockey. Organisers say the event is a draw for tourists for a number of reasons. “When tourists come to the camel racing venues, they see something new. They see how people treat the camels and how the camels compete with each other. They also see how Emirati society promotes camels, says the clubs CEO and General Amanager Ali Saeed Bin Saroud. Camel racing was promoted by the former UAE president, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan as a way of bringing camels and back into mainstream Dubai culture. The Dubai Royal Family also actively support camel racing as a way of preserving the traditional Bedouin culture. Desert culture The Al Marmoom Heritage Festival is Dubai’s annual celebration of the traditional Arabian desert culture and vital role which it plays in the cultural identity of its people. Traditional markets, music and dancing are another way in which the Bedouin culture is kept alive and enjoyed by Dubai locals and tourists alike. Arabic hospitality German expat Ursula Musch moved to Dubai around 20 years ago after first visiting in 1993. She now breeds camels and encourages tourists to experience the Bedouin customs for themselves, as they, like her, may just find their passion in life. My passion or my message is I want to give foreigners, other people the chance to know something from the Arabic hospitality, from their tradition, from their culture, to show it to give it to other people who don’t

programme.desc: In a land of stark beauty and natural extremes, a colony of Viking settlers vanished centuries ago. Follow along as our writer travels on a National Geographic ship from Iceland to Greenland and into a remote fjord — to seek the truth.

programme.title: Marco Bettio
programme.desc: Owner and founder Marco Bettio speaks about his journey to success, and bringing a bit of "Italian Love" to Shanghai.Marco’s infectious personality immediately disarms you, it’s no wonder Goodfellas is one of the city’s best establishments to find authentic Italian comfort food. His passion for authenticity and obsession for comfort, pours out every minute you spend here. This place has a charming personality and we went directly to the source.Interview: MARCO BETTIOWhen I came here 10 years ago and started to do some consulting. I started to receive a lot of guests from all around the world..and I was always forced to bring them to fine dining places. I noticed that my clients weren’t really comfortable in the fine dining experience the first day they arrived in Shanghai.That’s what moved me to bring this real Italian dining experience to this area. I would say that we would always try to give a tailormade type of service. Greeting everybody, making them feel comfortable, it’s one of the most important things for us.Actually, “Goodfellas”..is meant to mean “good friends”..and this is the idea. There is no ego, there is no name of the chef, or my name on the door,..nothing but “Goodfellas.” It’s a place to for a good time with your friends, business partners, clients..to have an intimate experience in an enjoyable way.Chef Antonio is a great master, we actually call him “the maestro”,..it’s the italian way to address a very experienced chef. Since day one, Chef has been in charge of everything inside the kitchen...scouting the best ingredients and creating the recipes. Coming from big hotels, he initially wanted the kitchen to be very serious, less smiling, less interactive, etc..I never agreed with this, so we had to find a balance. And it took almost a year until we found that balance,...after he saw the happy customers and atmosphere we knew we were on to something and it because very harmonic. There is never an argument between the kitchen and the staff, and it’s amazing. This is a very big achievement..norma

programme.title: Duncan Lin
programme.desc: The Story of Duncan Lin“From my earliest memory, I have always liked drawing, but have never thought about making it my career,” says Duncan Lin, one of Taiwan’s most popular comics artists from Hualien. With a fanbase of 20 million and growing, Duncan has been approached by various renowned companies, such as Line, Asus, and TVBS for creative collaborations. He uses a caricature of himself as the main protagonist in his comics, which are centered around the hilarious going-ons of his daily life. With the cameras rolling, he wears his character as a mask, not wishing to expose his face. He is about 5’3, with a skinny frame, his dyed blonde hair peeking out from behind his mask. “My father always objected to my interest in drawing, but my mother was rather supportive. Some of my most precious memories are of those childhood drawings. I would show them to my mother, deeply excited, and she would look at them and say, ‘Oh, that’s [a] really nice picture’, and then display it on the fridge using a magnet. And I would feel so proud every time she did this. I would think, ‘Wow, I need to draw more, because I want more things to be displayed on the fridge’, and then slowly…. the fridge got filled up. And the old drawings would be removed, and the whole process would be repeated. And this small matter, and that fridge, they influenced me, and allowed me to feel like perhaps I should continue drawing in the future.”On the other hand, Duncan’s father was a strict figure, quite the opposite of his mother. “My father never smiled at me from the day I was born till the day he passed away. He never genuinely smiled at me and was always kind of distant - he’s a very, very strict kind of father - so we never really talked much, and of course after I graduated from high school, I left home.” Like all typical Asian parents, Duncan’s father hammered the notion: ‘do not pursue art because you’ll starve to death’, and that if he became an artist, ‘you’ll only earn money after you’re dead’.During his university years, Duncan majored i

programme.title: Sustaining Black-owned Businesses Into The Future
programme.desc: Capital One leader Zainep Mahmoud and Boss Women Media Founder Marty McDonald discuss the ongoing work to strengthen Black and brown small business owners with the resources to strengthen local communities and create a more equitable society for all.

programme.title: Paying For College In A Post-COVID World
programme.desc: Even before the global pandemic, the value proposition of borrowing to finance a college degree was becoming increasingly difficult to prove. Now, smart financial planning is critical to ensuring that financing a degree delivers real ROI. Tisa Silver Canady joins us to share how to budget for college in uncertain times.

programme.title: First Black Billionaire s Mission to Get Blacks 14 Trillion in Reparations
programme.desc: Iconic entrepreneur Bob Johnson has broken barriers and built empires as founder of BET and chairman of The RLJ Companies, a diversified conglomerate. In an exclusive interview with Black Enterprise CEO Butch Graves, he shares his proposals to transfer wealth to African Americans using reparations and boost black political power through the creation of an independent party.

programme.title: Branding Guru Kimberly Blackwell and a look at our Women of Power Awardees
programme.desc: This week on Women of Power, we highlight Kimberly Blackwell, founder & CEO of marketing and media firm PMM Agency. She shares tips on what made her one of the nation’s best business leaders. Then we go behind the runway with fashion’s “Fairy Godmother” Bethann Hardison. She tells us her journey from model to mentor of some of the nations supermodels in fashion. From there we visit the president of Rensselaer Institute, Dr. Shirley Ann Jackson. Shes a pioneer in the collegiate world of technology and research who is keeping the nation’s oldest technological school at the forefront of the science and tech. And finally, we go inside the kitchen with Leah Chase, a renowned chef and owner of New Orleans staple “Dooky Chase Restaurant.” She weathered Hurricane Katrina and continues to contribute to the Creole culture of the French Quarters.

programme.title: Developing Profitable Partnerships
programme.desc: Harlem’s Fashion Row founder Brandice Daniel creates bridges between fashion designers of color and mainstream brands such as Nike, Gap, Target, Marriott, and Coca-Cola

programme.title: Backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe
programme.desc: We go backstage with Bell Biv DeVoe as they get ready for their long-anticipated New Edition reunion tour. Then we catch up with Curtis Benjamin, the founder of Save Our Daughters.” Hes on a mission to help daughters around the country. Then we talk to Ron Hickland, the engineer behind some of Americas top performing bowling balls. Hes shows us the career benefits of a STEM education. And finally, Dr. Khalil Muhammad shows us how hes lifting his community through the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture.

programme.title: Making The Monument - Vietnam Heroes
programme.desc: When the nation called them to Vietnam, the Lone Star State sent thousands of its young men and women to serve and fight in a long and controversial war that would leave the nation divided and its veterans unrecognized. Four decades later, a group of those veterans banded together for one last mission – to build a monument honoring Texas Vietnam Veterans on the state Capitol grounds. From the sculpting process to the creation of a sacred memorial that rests in the monument’s heart to the dedication, their journey would take nearly as long as the war itself, and result in a long overdue tribute to a generation.

programme.title: Covert Cabal
programme.desc: Dive deep into the details of military technology from around the world.

programme.title: Ward CarrollTV Shorts
programme.desc: Ward talks aviation and current events.

programme.title: Portrait of Courage - Flight 93
programme.desc: Tom Burnett was a businessman from California, Todd Beamer was a software salesman from New Jersey. They just happened to be aboard flight 93, on September 11, 2001. The passengers knew they were going to die. A number of them had made cell-phone calls from the plane. They had been told what had happened at the world trade center. But Tom and Todd and others decided that Flight 93 wasn’t going to be used to kill more Americans, even if they couldn’t save themselves. Tom and Todd were part of the group who devised the plan to take the airplane back at any cost.

programme.title: The Source Family
programme.desc: Hollywood. Veganism. Murder. A charismatic leader and suspected bank robber starts a cult — and a restaurant empire in 70s Los Angeles — based on organic food and psychedelic rock. The outlandish lifestyle made the group the darlings of Hollywood, but their outsider ideals and murder controversy attracted the attention of the authorities. Many still think Father Yod is God.

programme.title: Turning Point
programme.desc: It’s been called the final frontier of medicine -- Alzheimer’s disease -- the most feared of all maladies, with no way to cure, stop or even slow its insidious progression. But now, after decades of researchers perseverance in the lab, filmmaker James Keach takes us inside the quest for the scientific breakthrough that could be the first step toward making Alzheimer’s itself a distant memory.

programme.title: The Decline of Western Civilization: Part III
programme.desc: Shot 20 years after the original and released in 1998, director Penelope Spheeris ends the trilogy focusing more on social issues rather than music while exploring the lives of the hardcore fans of punk rock ("gutterpunks") in 1990s Los Angeles featuring Final Conflict, Naked Aggression and Litmus Green.

programme.title: FishON! | Weathering the Storm: Walleye on Porcupine Lake
programme.desc: In this exciting episode, we venture out onto Porcupine Lake for some beautiful walleye action with Craig Salmonson from Timmins Angling Adventures. Patience was key as we waited for a break in challenging weather conditions—but it all paid off with an unforgettable day on the water. Tune in for expert tips, stunning scenery, and the thrill of fishing in Northern Ontario!

programme.title: Forbidden Science | Is It Real?
programme.desc: Forbidden Science is a unique blend of noir science fiction and erotic programming. Set in the near future, the stories revolve around the evil corporation, 4Ever Innovations, whose young and brilliant scientists download and sell memories. They replace those we've lost with clones and devise technology that helps us live out our greatest fantasies; from saving a failed relationship, to creating the perfect lover, to being irresistible to the opposite sex - but sometimes our deepest desires come at a terrible price. 4Ever offers customers the opportunity to live out their fantasies in a virtual world but there are secrets within 4Ever Innovations that may cost you your life.

programme.title: Drake Bell vs. Josh Peck
programme.desc: S1:E15 Everyone loved Drake & Josh but people don’t know the dark story behind the world’s favorite kids’ show. Josh struggled with his weight and addiction while filming the show. It was always painful for him to be the chubby sidekick to the cool, popular Drake. Then Josh shocked the world when he revealed that he and Drake weren’t even really friends. Drake was furious, sparking a massive backlash against Josh. But no one knew just how dark of a path Drake had gone down.

programme.title: Geri Mel B Spicy Secrets
programme.desc: Behind The Secret Geri Halliwell and Mel B Hid for Years: While the world was busy obsessing over the SPICE GIRLS, behind the scenes, two members were also bonding in a spicy way! What REALLY caused ﻿Geri Halliwell to leave the group? And why did she break Mel ﻿Bs heart? This video reveals a side of Ginger and Scary Spice you never knew about.

programme.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Rebuilding Family
programme.desc: Arnold Schwarzenegger was forced to be tough at an early age. Abused by his father, Arnold tried to bury his painful past by putting all of his energy into bodybuilding. When he started a family with his wife, everything appeared perfect to the outside world... Until Arnold was publicly exposed for cheating on his wife and destroying his family. Why did Arnold cheat? And how far back do the lies go?

programme.title: Ben Affleck Jennifer Lopez Together Again
programme.desc: Prior to getting back with JLo, Ben Afflecks life had been nothing short of TRAGIC... Why was Jennifer Garner completely fed up with him? And how did Ben almost DESTROY his family?

programme.title: Colin Angelina From Rebels To Parents
programme.desc: Hollywood Rebels Colin Farrell and Angelina Jolies deep connection goes far beyond their past romance. Almost two decades later, the two are still very much supportive of one another and share a great deal in common, both being single parents.

programme.title: Britney Spears Finally Free
programme.desc: Britney Spears ESCAPED her conservatorship but she still has ONE FIGHT LEFT! She﻿ tried to tell the world what her family kept secret for 13 years, but her father threatened her. In this video, their dark secrets are finally REVEALED.

programme.title: Naomi Campbell Nelson Mandella Defending A Model
programme.desc: Supermodel Naomi Campbell was one of the most in-demand models of her time, but when the violent side of Naomi came out, she faced 7 years in prison! Then... Nelson Mandela stepped in to teach her a powerful lesson. Why did Nelson Mandela defend the world’s most controversial model?

programme.title: Dave Bautista Kumail Nanjiani True To Yourself
programme.desc: Kumail Nanjiani SHOCKED the world when he achieved an EXTREME body transformation! Despite being a famous comedian, actor, and screenwriter, Kumails real life was NOT all glamorous. What tragedy struck before he could propose to his wife? And how did Dave Bautista make things WORSE?

programme.title: Vin Paul Forever Family
programme.desc: When the explosive news of Paul Walker’s death surfaced, it shocked the world. The Fast and Furious franchise would never be the same - and Paul’s daughter, Meadow Walker, was left without a father. So why did Paul leave her with Vin Diesel? And what important lesson on parenting did Paul teach Vin before he passed away?

programme.title: Dwyane Wade s Fight to Support his Kids
programme.desc: This is how Dwyane Wades custody battle from hell against ex-wife forced him to show up BETTER.

programme.title: Travis and Kourtney Better for the Kids
programme.desc: Legendary rock star and Blink-182 member Travis Barkers biggest fear came true when in 2008 he survived the impossible... his plane crashed and caught fire. He was one of the lucky two to survive. After fighting for his life in the hospital, he fell into a suicidal spiral taking his family and children down with him, until he realized an important truth. ﻿﻿Will his new relationship with Kourtney Kardashian survive his dark past and who predicted the plane crash before it even happened?

programme.title: Dave Bautista Breaking Out of the Box
programme.desc: Desperate to make a change in his life, Dave Bautista left his brutal childhood behind to become a wrestler. But when the WWE denied Dave from pursuing his biggest dream, everything started breaking down. Why did Dave walk away from a successful career in the WWE? And why did John Cena make everything worse?

programme.title: Jane Fonda Vs. The US Government
programme.desc: Actress Jane Fonda took the public by surprise when she was photographed overseas for her activism. When Nixon found out, Jane became target enemy #1 and the country called her “despicable”. Why was the President suspicious of Jane’s motives? And how did Jane Fonda fight back?

programme.title: Janet Jackson Breaks Her Silence
programme.desc: Janet Jackson reveals the haunting story of how she was treated unfairly in Hollywood after the Super Bowl mishap with Justin Timberlake.

programme.title: Deshauna Barber From Soldier to Miss USA
programme.desc: When Army officer-turned-beauty queen Deshauna Barber takes the stage, her path in life is almost unbelievable. She shares the secrets that haunted her for years in this exclusive Goalcast Original.

programme.title: Integrity or Nothing
programme.desc: This is how the worlds biggest music manager, Scooter Braun, climbed out of his rock-bottom to make it to the top. What started as sweat, tears and hustle blossomed into a life of generosity and compassion, all because of one important piece of wisdom from his father.

programme.title: A Lost Husband
programme.desc: This stay-at-home mom has had it enough with her husband taking her for granted. When an unexpected turn of events puts him in a bad spot, he has no choice but to face the extent of his arrogance.

programme.title: The Fundamental Truth About Love
programme.desc: Adam Reid Shares Expert Advice on a Fundamental Truth About Love. This Speech about the true source of love will change how you approach relationships forever!

programme.title: Blue or Red pill?
programme.desc: Mindvalley founder Vishen Lakhiani shares the secret to success and teaches a confused student how to make the right decisions in life. The choice is yours: Will you take the blue pill or the red pill?

programme.title: A Father's Worst Nightmare
programme.desc: Should parents control their children or trust them to do the right thing?

programme.title: Life Lessons from Gangsters
programme.desc: Father Gregory Boyles work as the founder of Homeboy Industries has greatly impacted the lives of so many. His hilarious and inspiring story reminds us all that there is no us and them, just us.

programme.title: The Simple Rule that will Change your Life
programme.desc: Life coach and motivational speaker Mel Robbins shares her simple solution for outsmarting your brain to make better decisions and improve your life.

programme.title: Real Stories Frank Shamrock
programme.desc: UFC legend Frank Shamrock has a backstory you probably wouldn’t expect from one of the toughest fighters alive... As a kid, Frank Shamrock was the farthest thing from being a UFC legend—he was a criminal. He was put into Juvenile Detention Centers for all sorts of crimes. He wanted a way to escape the scary, torturously abusive home he grew up in, where his stepfather would make him do things that broke him physically and emotionally. But his tough, painful, and wildly unpredictable journey to becoming a UFC legend shows us success isn’t something that happens instantly, it’s a slow gradual process that’s reserved for those who don’t give up when things get hard.

programme.title: Jay Shetty Lesson from a Famous Failure
programme.desc: In this candid speech, former monk and internet guru Jay Shetty reflects on his sacred tenure and finds the one universal lesson that he learned through his years of struggle.

programme.title: Great Day to be Alive
programme.desc: Eloquent and charismatic, Ian Humphrey shares the journey of his amazing, inspiring life, as he travels through comas and foster homes, prisons and a rebirth in gratitude.

programme.title: When Everything Falls Apart
programme.desc: Brendon Burchard recounts how a tragic heartbreak and a near-death experience led him to discover the 3 most important questions you can ask yourself.

programme.title: The Goalcast App Has A New Look
programme.desc: Famous cosmologist and all-around inspirational human Stephen Hawking delivers a final speech before he departed us for worlds beyond.

programme.title: Umbrella Insurance Trusts vs. Wills
programme.desc: "Ric Edelman explains the importance of umbrella liability insurance, the difference between a trust and a will, and interviews legendary newsman Sam Donaldson."

programme.title: Your Money Your Wealth Re-Boot Your IRA
programme.desc: Are you neglecting one of the most precious assets that you have? When it comes to individual retirement accounts or IRAs, many people have a practice of ""fund it and forget it"". But there are strategies you can implement to help maximize the money it generates. The ""Dynamic Duo"" of financial planning, Joe Anderson, CFP, and Alan Clopine, CPA, will help you Re-Boot Your IRA

programme.title: When Do Roth Conversions STOP Making Sense
programme.desc: "Ryan in Texas is in the 32 tax bracket. Where should he save for retirement so he’ll be in a lower bracket? Should Weronika in Texas pay the taxes now to convert to Roth for lifetime tax-free growth in the future, even though she’s in the 37 tax bracket? And Jerry in Phoenix wonders if there is a point where Joe would come to the conclusion that Roth conversions no longer make sense? Stay tuned for the 7 reasons to consider NOT converting to Roth, today on Your Money, Your Wealth podcast number 535 with Joe Anderson, CFP® and Big Al Clopine, CPA. First up, a word of Roth conversion thanks from Al in Florida."

programme.title: Why BlackRock is Building A New Investment Market... In Saudi Arabia
programme.desc: "BlackRock has been a long-time champion of investments based off Environmental, Social and Governance criteria which obviously vibes well with the authoritarian Petro-state. The companies CEO Larry Fink said in an interview that the Kingdom “has become an increasingly attractive destination for international investments” but that’s not really true… So what is Blackrock ACTUALLY doing in Saudi Arabia?"

programme.title: What Do CEOs Actually Do End of the 40 year career
programme.desc: A good CEO can build an average company into a billion-dollar success, and a bad CEO can destroy even a strong company in less than a year. With so much on the line shareholders happily pay these privileged men an women millions of dollars every year for their services. But they are still just employees, they come to work every day and go home like everyone else. So what do these people actually do all day? The real answer to what a CEO actually does is… whatever they want. Within the company they are only answerable to the board of directors and the only power that board of directors has over them is to decide their compensation package, or to fire them. The board of directors themselves are representatives of the companies’ shareholders and in a lot of small companies the biggest shareholder and the chairman of the board is also the CEO so the board can’t do anything apart from give advice and hope the CEO listens to it. That’s only for small companies though, it is INCREDIBLY rare for the CEO’s of public companies to have this much power, in fact there is only ONE company in the S&P500 where the CEO can not be voted out by the board and that’s META’s Mark Zuckerberg since he owns a majority of a special type of share in the company. For every other CEO their only real job is to not get fired by the board. The best way to do that is to keep the board that represents the shareholders happy by delivering strong investment returns. Make line go up is a simple objective but it still doesn’t answer what they actually do all day since that goal can be achieved in so many different ways, but I have to make this video before Good Work makes a funnier, better version of it… again… So let’s imagine that you wake up one day in the body of a random Fortune Five Hundred CEO and you need to make it though the day without being found out, here are the things that ONLY a CEO can do from the moment they you walk into the office until the moment you leave… probably quiet late at night… The first task that ONLY a CEO is allowed t

programme.desc: Wes Nolan wakes up in an abandoned warehouse with a case of amnesia. He has been kidnapped by someone named "Lazarus" who has him held captive in order to get the cure for an Ebola outbreak. Instead of destroying the Ebola, however, Wes' protein mutated the virus into something much more potent. Now Wes must try to regain his memory and try to find the cure.

programme.title: MADNESS
programme.desc: Alex is a disturbed young man bent on destruction, but when his plans get interrupted by his step-sister and her four, hot college roommates, madness ensues. Confined to their parents house as a blizzard moves in, the six settle in for a long, boring night. However, when the power goes out and one of the girls accidentally dies, Alexs odd behavior becomes more and suspect. He tries desperately to cover his tracks, but all the while he hides an even darker deed and in the end, only one will survive.

programme.title: THE KAMASUTRA GARDEN
programme.desc: A successful businessman, Steve Banks, an exotic madam, Sheila, and a scandalous sex guru, Swami Kamlesh, team up to start an elite brothel called The Kamasutra Garden in Nevada. What is so unique about this brothel? It is the only brothel in the world where the girls are trained in Kamasutra, the ancient art and science of lovemaking. At Steves request, an award-winning documentary filmmaker William visits The Kamasutra Garden to prepare a documentary about the brothel. Before visitingThe Kamasutra Garden, William had never been to a brothel He tucked in a remote desert town in Nevada, The Kamasutra Garden, where the girls were young, beautiful, and every mans fantasy. However, William soon discovered the complex lives and secrets of the women who worked there.

programme.title: SKIN BUSINESS
programme.desc: THE SKIN BUSINESS is a movie about how the Internet has cut into the profits of what was once thought to be a recession-proof business, and how directors and producers are gambling on a newly- popular genre of porn: the porn parody. This film shows how the industry takes on some of entertainments most popular franchises and makes them xxx; from Batman, to the Addams Family, to the Brady Bunch and even animated features like American Dad, there is nothing in mainstream that cant be made fun of in porn. If you love porn, you will love this movie. If you are a virgin to the world of porn, consider this Porn 101.

programme.title: Meet The Women Staff - Madras Crocodile Bank Trust
programme.desc: The Madras Crocodile Bank Trust and Centre for Herpetology (MCBT) is a reptile zoo and herpetology research station, located 40 kilometers (25 mi) south of the city of Chennai, in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. The center is both a registered trust and a recognized zoo and comes under the purview of the Central Zoo Authority, Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India. It was established with the aim of saving three Indian endangered species of crocodilethe marsh or mugger crocodile, the saltwater crocodile, and the gharial, which at the time of the founding of the trust were all nearing extinction.

programme.title: Saree Block Printing Tutorial
programme.desc: This series caters to fashion, beauty, skincare, and lifestyle enthusiasts. It offers diverse content, including skincare & makeup tutorials, fashion tips, lifestyle vlogs, and exclusive interviews with celebrities about their lifestyles. Our team of experts strives to provide the latest trends and advice in the beauty and fashion industry to help our viewers look and feel their best. With Say Swag, you can expect high-quality content that is entertaining and informative, bringing you closer to your favorite celebrities and their unique lifestyles. Join us to discover the latest and greatest in fashion, beauty, and lifestyle.

programme.title: Naayagi Episode 27
programme.desc: Nayagi is a 2018 Indian Tamil-language Family Drama series. It premiered on 19 February 2018 on Sun TV, replacing Deivamagal, and was replaced by Anbe Vaa and it ended on 31 October 2020. The show was produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S Kumaran. Nayagi was also re-aired on Kalaignar TV from 1 March 2021 and it ended its run on 9 July 2022 Plot Anandhi, a middle-class woman, struggles to keep her life together while dealing with an alcoholic father and his debts. Though her landlady Sargunam is formidable, she wishes to destroy Kalivardhan.

programme.title: Deivamagal Episode 56
programme.desc: Deivamagal is an Indian Tamil-language soap opera starring Vani Bhojan and Krishna. It was broadcast on Sun TV initially from Monday to Friday and later extended to Saturday at 8 PM from 25 March 2013 to 17 February 2018 for 1,466 episodes. The show replaced S. Kumarans successful soap, Thirumathi Selvam, and replaced by Nayagi. The show is produced by Vikatan Televistas Pvt Ltd and directed by S. Kumaran. This serial was shot in Pollachi, Chennai, Chengalpet, Hyderabad, Kerala, Puducherry, and Cuddalore. This is the first TV serial shot in the Bay of Bengal Plot Prakash his wife Sathyapriya and his eldest sister-in-law Gayathris conspiracies against their families to conquer Prakshs ancestral property Jai Hind Vilas.
